channel.title: Before/After Experiment!
channel.description:
Hi everybody!
I would like to propose a bit of an experiment. Up until BM's release, post what you think you will like about the mod, dislike, your thoughts, etc. When the mod comes out and you play it, edit your original post to include what you actually think of the mod. It would be interesting to see the difference!
I will go first. -------------------
I think that BM will have a sort of "Valve quality" polish. I am expecting a few bugs here or there, but otherwise I think that BM will be the best HL2 mod to date, even outshining GMod. I think that the level design will be top-notch, the models will look professional, etc. I am, however worried about the quality of the voice acting and non-Valve made animations.
---------------------
EDIT: Just played up to the beginning of We've got Hostiles and so far it has exceeded my expectations by miles! All of my concerns about voice acting and non-Valve made animations are now gone. My only complaint about the mod is a little picky - the video/gameplay option defaults are pretty bad. My game was set to easy by default, and my video quality had all of the textures/effects set to low/medium, even though my shitty macbook(I used bootcamp) can handle max settings on almost everything. Everything else, however, is on-par with Valve games, and is much better than any recent CoD game. Definitely worth the 7-year wait!

item.title: Before/After Experiment!
item.dc:creator: ZindroVokun
item.description:
Malidictus:
  1. Black Mesa turned out to be a “reimagining” of Half-Life with a lot more humour (not something I appreciate))

I personally thought HL was silly to begin with, the first one at least. The barneys and scientists were bumbling idiots, and the rooms were utterly insane - I mean the crate room? They have a room where they hang crates for fun? BM kept it and tried to make it make a bit more sense (the crates look like they go places, still weird though).

The only real example of humour that didn’t seem realistic was probably the toilet paper joke. The guard banter seemed pretty much like how a security guy would act to a co-worker; and most of the dialogue post-disaster seemed much more serious, with the exception of a scientist or two.

I expected HL1 with graphical updates and re-voiced. I didn’t expect them to go ahead and make it for the most part even more fun and cinematic. This has been a really good mod. But, I didn’t follow it all the way (due to its long dev time) so I guess I never got over-hyped.

Read full topic

item.title: Before/After Experiment!
item.dc:creator: Malidictus
item.description:
I honestly expected basically “Half-Life with better graphics.” That’s my own fault for no being better informed and just guessing blindly. Beyond this, I expected Black Mesa to look good, play better but be plagued with bad voice acting. I also expected it to be complete.

What actually happened:

  1. Black Mesa turned out to be a “reimagining” of Half-Life with a lot more humour (not something I appreciate) and very different location layouts in places. I am not disappointed with anything that’s been done to the levels themselves, I just wish there were more of it Specifically, more On a Rail, more Surface Tension, more Forget About Freeman, more Residue Processing. All of these feel like they were “streamlined” and had large chunks of them taken out in the process. Basically, I like it enough that I wish there were more

  2. Black Mesa does look good. VERY good, in fact. And the voice acting doesn’t suck. Quite on the contrary - with the exception of a single line, the voice acting is GREAT! Eli doesn’t sound much like himself but Cleiner is spot on, and all the other unnamed characters sound convincing and well-acted. I’m quite amazed at this. Black Mesa is the first non-commercial product I’ve seen come out with voice acting that doesn’t make me want to strangle the actors. You guys should be making money out of this.

  3. I found out that Xen wouldn’t be included pretty early on, and I found out that the tutoria wouldn’t exist. Xen, at least, we’ll eventually see, but I’m still sad to lose the tutorial. To me, Half-Life is the only game where the tutorial actually felt like part of the story. Ah, well, at least Xen, I’m sure, will be amazing, if the rest of Black Mesa is anything to go by. I just hope it doesn’t take another eight years

Read full topic

item.title: Before/After Experiment!
item.dc:creator: dky.tehkingd.u
item.description:
dky.tehkingd.u:

On-Topic: I think Black Mesa will just play well. It looks very professional and I’m looking forward to playing because of that. I’m especially excited for the HECU battles. Ultimate HECU fan right here! B)

When mod releases and I get past the WGH chapter, I’ll repost here with my thoughts on the new HECU.

Bumping this thread because I said I would.

The new HECU are great. Others might disagree. I’ve heard people say they’re too difficult. I’ve heard people say that the voice acting sucks.

But in MY opinion the HECU are really fun to fight. Many times I die to them and I’m not disappointed. Rather, I’m impressed. They, unlike enemies in many other games, are able to use their advantages to their advantage. They’re aggressive. They push. They flank when you don’t expect. They’re COMPETENT. If you die to them, then it’s always your own fault, and likewise when you win a battle against them, it’s always because you actually out-fight them rather than the AI being stupid (as HL1 grunts sometimes were). I’ve found myself having to re-do many battles with a different strategy each time, because the last time I used a bad strategy and got killed.

As for the voices, I’m okay with them. Honestly if it’s a choice between these and the ridiculous robot voices from HL1, I’d gladly choose the new ones. Although sometimes it’s kind of ridiculous when they say “Dooo iiit” over and over again in an almost seductive manner for absolutely no reason. :meh:

Read full topic

item.title: Before/After Experiment!
item.dc:creator: SniperNoSniping9
item.description:
I’m probably going to regret this later but…
I’m not going to lie I’m slightly disappointed. I was so hyped up for this game…And I feel as though it fell a little short.
The graphics are sexy as hell. I am overly impressed with the graphics.
I just feel turned off. It’s like looking at a sexy women and then you’re like “Hi, I’m (Insert name here)” and shes like “LIEK OMG HAI! I’M SARAH AND I LIKE” and she just goes on and on and never shuts up and while you’re trying to look for a place to talk she just keeps slamming the door and keeps talking.

BM is sexy, but I feel like I’m fumbling around too much trying to find the next doorway and or exit hole to get to the next part and I feel its unnecessary. Maybe its because I’m used to HL1 in all its simpleness. It may also be because I’m really tired.
The voice acting is nice. The guns, the sounds. The whole thing is awesome. I just got really bored trying to fumble around trying to open every door to get to the next part of the stage.

But I would like to say Thank you to the dev’s you guys worked real hard and did a great job.

Read full topic

item.title: Before/After Experiment!
item.dc:creator: Gloric
item.description:
Crypt19:

Good luck with that.

Good luck with what? i’m just guessing in the dark. My assumptions aren’t some sort of criteria I expect.

Crypt19:

Nope.

I never said to switch over to it permanently. But judging from that he wouldn’t do it due to the disruptive nature anyhow. I still don’t see how it could be any worse than the narration changing to Piratese for 1 episode. But that’s just me.

Read full topic

item.title: Before/After Experiment!
item.dc:creator: polyphonyEX
item.description:
I predict a ‘Valvelike’ experience.

Take from that what you will but I predict a game so polished and fundamentally GOOD that it dwarfs any reservation that could be had at all.

item.title: Before/After Experiment!
item.dc:creator: FrontLineAssembly
item.description:
No complaints. Can’t wait to hear the awesome voice acting (especially Gman, but we won’t see him in this release) and see the awesome animations, models, textures, etc. I bet this will be the best HL2 mod till date.

Read full topic

item.title: Before/After Experiment!
item.dc:creator: PlausibleSarge
item.description:
Crypt19:

Another thing I have on my mind as of 30 seconds ago is whether or not the puzzles have been redesigned so heavily that HL veterans won’t know exactly what to do. I seriously welcome the physics-based puzzles I’ve heard about.

I personally wish for a mix of old and new puzzles, or a twist on some of the old puzzles, simply because, while solving new puzzles can be fun, solving some of the old puzzles in new environments has great nostalgia value and can be just as fun despite the easiness of the puzzle. I still enjoy the tripmine puzzle in Surface Tension despite the fact that I know it by heart

Read full topic

item.title: Before/After Experiment!
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Another thing I have on my mind as of 30 seconds ago is whether or not the puzzles have been redesigned so heavily that HL veterans won’t know exactly what to do. I seriously welcome the physics-based puzzles I’ve heard about.

Post Play Edit: Once again, devs delivered. New level designs came familiar but new puzzles.

Read full topic

item.title: Before/After Experiment!
item.dc:creator: Sentinelrv
item.description:
pinkribbonscars:

My biggest worries are the Hecu Soldiers AI and their voice overs. The aggressiveness of them was my favorite part of Half Life, and I hope they managed to carry it over to BMS. Everything else looks incredible, Valve quality, even, so I’m not worried about the rest.

I’m also concerned about the aggressiveness of the soldiers. That’s the biggest downfall in Half-Life 2 for me. The Combine were way too easy to fight, where the Half-Life 1 soldiers were very challenging.

Read full topic

The only things I’m worried about are, as said before, non-Valve animations and maybe some of the voice acting, although I’m not too worried about the G-Man as he sounds fine in the trailer. Oh, and I hope it isn’t too short.

item.title: Before/After Experiment!
item.dc:creator: fade
item.description:
I just want the levels to feel a little bit more realistic than they were in HL1 (for instance, i want office complex to feel more like an actual office)… Its obvious the limitations of the engine HL1 was build on was the main factor, but from what ive seen thus far a little bit more realism to the environments is exactly what we are getting…

Read full topic
